bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 169, Number 104 (Wednesday, June 14, 2023)][House]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mr. BARR:H.R. 4102.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Article I, Section 8 of the United States Constitution.The single subject of this legislation is:To provide individuals battling addiction with thestability and assistance needed to rebuild their lives.[Page H2933]

latestAction.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Health, Education, Labor, and Pensions. (text: CR S2099)

item.text: Referred to the House Committee on Financial Services.

summary.text:
Recovery Housing Stability and Support Act of 2023

This bill reauthorizes through FY2028 the Recovery Housing Program, which is administered by the Department of Housing and Urban Development. The program supports the provision of transitional housing for those who are in recovery from a substance-use disorder for up to two years or until the individual finds permanent housing, whichever is earlier.

bill.title: Recovery Housing Stability and Support Act of 2023

item.title: Recovery Housing Stability and Support Act of 2023
Recovery Housing Stability and Support Act of 2023
To amend the SUPPORT for Patients and Communities Act to reauthorize the Recovery Housing Program.

latestAction.text: Referred to the House Committee on Financial Services.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
